page.title: 16SPRING CLOSE BURWELL.
page.content: {Spring Close}is an area where everyone can play.{The Parish Council}has recently{bought it for Â£20,000. There are{remains of a castle}_ some hills and a marsh in the moat _ with hundreds of pathways. Children have made a{BMX track}here. Near the stream is a{rope swing.}Cow's come down to the stream.A road near by is called{Mandeville }because Geoffrey De Mandeville was a robber baron in Ely.King Stephen built castles around Ely to trap him.But Geoffrey straight away attacked {Burwell Castle}while it was being built.He was hit and carried off to Mildenhall where he died.There were thought to be catapult and seige mounds but they were really wheel-barrow tracks and soil dumps. Other clues showed that the castle was never finished.
